Common name: Southern water skink  
*Eulamprus tympanum* are a type of skink that are endemic to southern Australia. Their habitat includes swamps and creeks in mountain areas.   
Their back is colored golden to black and their snout to vent length measures about 7.5 cm.  
They are viviparous, mate in spring and give birth to live young in mid to late summer.  
(Sumner, 2016)
